fields.description:
When adding a user to a group, it doesn't show an error message if the user doesn't exist.

Example: 
In previous versions of Confluence 3.3.3, the costumer tried to add a non-existing user to a group he would receive the following error message: "The following error(s) occurred: User xyz123 could not be found. Please confirm his or her existence with a Confluence Administrator."
fields.summary: No Error Message When Adding a Non-exisitng User To a Group

 # The linking in the exported Word document is translated as:
 ** Internal page linking - D:\display\ds\Welcome+to+the+Confluence+Demonstration+Space
 ** Internal attachment linking - D:\Users\Hanis\Downloads\attach_0ba7561890f2e2b087628e00a8af1509
 # Expected links:

 ** Internal attachment linking - [http://localhost:8083/download/attachments/1114116/002.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1346670162000]

Only external links work in the exported Word document. This problem however does not exist in Confluence 3.5.x.

In the New XHTML Editor, somehow internal linking of pages/attachments are broken.

Current versions of Confluence don't expose this setting anymore. it was there in pre 4.0 versions
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Number+of+Ancestors+to+Show+in+Breadcrumbs

Either expose the setting again or give it a more useful value (i.e. 2)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26049].
  {panel}

h5. Note - as of Confluence 5.1.3 you can make an SSL LDAP connection that doesn't verify that the hostname and certificate match by unchecking this box when configuring your user directory:

!Screen Shot 2013-04-16 at 3.10.37 PM.png!

----
h5. Original issue description

Starting Confluence 4.2, the embedded crowd has been upgraded from version 2.3.2 to 2.4. This includes the security fix [CWD-2690] (won't be visible to public) that has been announced in Crowd 2.3.6 release notes - [Crowd 2.3.6 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Crowd+2.3.6+Release+Notes].

In Confluence, this has caused a lot of issues to customers with SSL-ed LDAP integration. Mainly because Confluence used to not verify that the server's SSL certificate is valid for the host name in the LDAP connection URL.

In Crowd, one can still have the old behaviour by workarounding it:
{quote}
As a workaround for deployments where there is an expected difference, using an 'ldaps' connection URL and leaving 'Secure SSL' unchecked will preserve the previous behaviour and make an SSL connection but will not verify that the hostname and certificate match.
{quote}

However, in Confluence, once you enable "Use SSL", there is no way we can fallback to the old behaviour like Crowd above.
!SSL_UserDirectory.png!

This feature request is to propose to have similar config/option like Crowd to allow an SSL LDAP connection but without verifying that the hostname and certificate match (fix of CWD-2690).

h5. Workaround options

# Fix the certificate to contain the correct name. This is the preferred (and most secure) fix.
# Edit /etc/hosts on the LDAP server to allow you to use the incorrect name in the certificate. Add the FQDN on the certificate and match it to the IP address of the server.
# (!) Backup Confluence database beforehand for safety purpose
#- Run the following SQL query:
{code}
UPDATE cwd_directory_attribute
SET attribute_value='false'
WHERE attribute_name='ldap.secure'
AND directory_id  = <desired_directory_ID>;
{code} 
#- Restart Confluence
#- (i) *Note*: The above option will always reverted to its default ('true') whenever you edit the user directory settings. Therefore, you'll need to run that query every time you do any changes on the user directory settings.
fields.summary: Add an option in User Directory settings to make an SSL LDAP connection but without verifying that the hostname and certificate match

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26043].
  {panel}

Sometimes costumers ask us how to disable users from changing their profile photos.
Unfortunately confluence don't have this feature.

Sometimes users put inappropriate pictures on their profiles, so It will be great if the administrators could change this behavior allowing or not users to change their photos.

*Workaround*

Our currently workaround is comment the form's on: <Confluence-Install>\confluence\users\editmyprofilepicture.vm
You can see more details here: [CSP-84730|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-84730]
fields.summary: Don't allow users to change their profile picture

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26041].
  {panel}

It has been confirmed in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-21705?focusedCommentId=273485&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-273485] that JRE is *enough* to run Confluence.

However, there are some inconsistencies in documentation which results in confusion among our users:
* [Installing Confluence on Linux from Archive File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+on+Linux+from+Archive+File#InstallingConfluenceonLinuxfromArchiveFile-2InstalltheJDKJavaDevelopmentKit] --> it states that "A JRE (Java Runtime Environment) is not enough" which is wrong
* [Installing Confluence on Windows from Zip File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+on+Windows+from+Zip+File#InstallingConfluenceonWindowsfromZipFile-2InstallaJavaDevelopmentKitJDK] --> there is no mention about JRE here (only JDK). Strangely enough, this page links to [Installing Java for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Java+for+Confluence] which only mentions about JRE, not JDK. This is confusing.
* [Setting the JAVA_HOME Variable in Windows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+the+JAVA_HOME+Variable+in+Windows] --> JAVA_HOME should be pointed to JDK directory. JRE_HOME should be pointed to JRE directory. Please fix this documentation. For proof, check {{<confluence-install>/conf/setclasspath.bat}} or the {{setenv.bat}} of any installer folder.

My two cents:
* Fix the inconsistencies above
* [Installing Java for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Java+for+Confluence] should be modified to provide a guide to install both JRE and JDK... and explains that Confluence can run with either JRE or JDK.
* Provide a separate page on how to set JRE_HOME (or merge the two into one)
fields.summary: Java requirement (JRE/JDK) across CAC is inconsistent!

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:

# Set Confluence language pack to Deutsch (Deutschland)
# Set the browser language setting to Germany (de)
# Create a new/fresh page
# At the bottom of the page, you'll see:
!1.JPG!
Translated in English: Be the first to like this.
# 'Like' the page and the status will changes to this:
!2.JPG!
Translated in English: You like this comment. NOTE: The user like the page but not the comment.
# Expected outcome (as tested in English language pack):
!3.JPG!
fields.summary: Misleading statement of 'Like' status in Deutsch

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# A user 'Like' a page and the page creator will received a notification:
!not1.JPG!
# The same user 'Unlike' the page and the page creator received the same/identical mail notification. This is misleading because the action is 'Unlike' instead of 'Like'.

Customer suggested that:
{quote}
But it should rather say "<user_name> does not like your page anymore" or maybe "<user_name> changed the Like Status of your page", or something like this. Another solution would be not to send an email at all when someone "unlikes" a page.
{quote}


Note: Tested on both English & Deutsch (Deutschland) language pack and this is affecting both languages.
fields.summary: Confluence is sending an 'Unlike' notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26037].
  {panel}

h1. Macro editing

h2. Problem
Currently editing macros is a *bit of slow* and not the quick "wiki" way. What I mean by this? Well, let's take a look at the *excerpt macro*. You have a page where there is a wall of text and a excerpt macro, alright now you think hey "I could be able to make this page _less_ confusing with just  hiding the excerpt macro.. no biggie.." and you start to hide the macro:
# You have to click *edit*
# You have to *select* the excerpt macro
# You have to click *Edit*
# You have to check the box that says *Hide Excerpted Content*
# You have to click *Save*
# Then you have to write to the "What did you change?" text area
# THEN you have to uncheck the "Notify watchers"
# Then you think "PHEW this was hard.. And only one tiny edit.."
# Then you click *Save*

h2. Solution suggestion
It would be more *easier and more quicker* way to do these *little* check box edits if you could just change the value just from selecting the macro.

There could be like "*Edit*", "*Remove*" and "*Hide*"(When pressed it changes to a button tht says says "*Unhide*").

Picture representation:
!example2.png!

I *don't know* if this ability is available/documented for the macro/usermacro developers. If by any chance this is available it would be nice to see this feature to be used in more macros.
fields.summary: Macro Toolbar for changing Macro Options

Solution:

fields.description:
We are currently running Confluence 4.0.4 so if this is fixed in a later version great, let me know.

If I take code blocks from a text editor and paste it into a code block in confluence it looses all of the existing formatting. This is extremely frustrating when dealing with things like JSON or XML fragments which can be fairly large and require a lot of reformatting to make them presentable. When I am pasting into a code block I expect the contents to be placed into the editor without stripping existing formatting.
fields.summary: Pasting code into a code block in Confluence looses existing formatting of the code
Syntax highlighting in code blocks when exporting to PDF

fields.description:
Standalone version of 4.2.8 running on a default Debian 6.0 system (inside OpenVZ, but that doesn't pose a problem for this issue).

The main website running on https://xn--danil-qsa.mostertman.org/confluence/ and the actual confluence site running on http://codex.finalx.nl:8090/confluence/

If I go to the dashboard on https://xn--danil-qsa.mostertman.org/confluence/dashboard.action everything seems fine.
I click the "Add Space" link, which is https://xn--danil-qsa.mostertman.org/confluence/spaces/createspace-start.action

I come to the Create Space page, BUT that's where things go wrong.
I enter "DNS" as space name and key, and it already shows me the URL:

https://xn--danil-qsa.mostertman.org/confluence/display/DNS

Which is fine.

When I click the Create (= submit) button however, it wants to post to https://xn--danil-qsa.mostertman.org/spaces/createspace.action .. which obviously doesn't exist.

The Server Base URL is set to https://xn--danil-qsa.mostertman.org/confluence/ and seems to be used throughout the rest of the site correctly.
The Context path is also set correctly in confluence/conf/server.xml.

Could you please let me know how to fix this?

Kind regards,

Daniël Mostertman

ps: xn--danil-qsa.mostertman.org is the name in the DNS which anything can handle normally, the IDN (cosmetic) name is daniël.mostertman.org
fields.summary: "Create space" does not honor Server Base URL in 4.2.8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26026].
  {panel}

*Steps to Replicate:*

# Set up two spaces, named FOO and BAR.
# Create a user that only has access to FOO
# On each of those spaces add a page named 'Home'
# Login as the user created in step 2
# Visit https://confluence/display/BAR/Home

*Result:* You'll see a page has been moved or renamed message, and on that page you'll see the logo and title of the space, even though you don't have permission to access it.

This is a problem for customers with Non-Disclosure Agreements as users can just brute force their way to figuring out what other spaces are on that instance.

*Workaround:* Use unique page names
fields.summary: Page may have been moved or renamed message displays details of space despite permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26016].
  {panel}

If you insert a web image to a page whose url contains the text {{download/attachments}} (such as this image {{http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/139467/confluence-3-0-profile-view.png?version=2&modificationDate=1243658607572}}), and then export that page as pdf, the image will not resolve, and you will get a warning in the logs 
{noformat}[confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent] getImageResource Could not retrieve image resource http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/139467/confluence-3-0-profile-view.png?version=2&modificationDate=1243658607572 during Confluence export : The byte array is not a recognized imageformat.
{noformat}

The pdf exports continue, but where the image should've been, is instead an empty space.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.13.0
Confluence 6.15.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload an image file to a page
# Navigate to the Attachments view of the page such as the URL below:
#* http://localhost:26130/c6130/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=65608
# Open the image uploaded from Step 1 *in a new tab* and the URL should look something like below:
#* http://localhost:26130/c6130/download/attachments/65608/bananas.jpg?api=v2
# Create a new page and insert a new image via the "Insert files and images"(CTRL+M) > *Images from the web*
# Enter the image URL from above step and Publish the page
# Verify the image can be seen in the View Page Mode
# Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The page is exported to PDF successfully with the image in the exported PDF file.

h3. Actual Results
The page is exported successfully to a PDF File but the image with the "{{download/attachments}}" URL is not included in the PDF

In the atlassian-confluence.log, this warning message is being logged:
{code}
2019-06-12 09:37:39,211 WARN [http-nio-26130-exec-2] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent] getImageResource Could not retrieve image resource http://localhost:26130/c6130/download/attachments/65608/bananas.jpg?api=v2 during Confluence export
 -- url: /c6130/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action | page: 65608 | traceId: 8c42641476275a1b | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:26130/c6130/display/PROJ/Banana+here | action: pdfpageexport
{code}

(!) The more "{{download/attachments}}" image links in the page, PDF Export of the page will take significantly longer time to complete.

h4. Workarounds:
* If the image is from Confluence, insert the image directly from the page using Confluence's file tools, rather than linking to the image URL. This will also have the added benefit of keeping the image updated if a new version of the image is ever uploaded:
*# Click the "Insert Files and Images" button on the toolbar.
*# Select "Search on other pages" in the dialogue sidebar.
*# Enter the page you'd like to insert the image from in the search bar, then click *Search*.
*# Select the images you'd like to insert.
*# Click *Insert*.
*# The page should now export successfully with the images.
* If the image is from an external site, add the problematic image as an attachment first, and then replace the web image with the attachment on the page before exporting.
fields.summary: pdf export fails to retrieve image if the image on the page is a web image and url contains "download/attachments"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25993].
  {panel}

It would be useful to exclude the current page from the list of pages shown by the Content by Label macro.

Can we have a parameter that allows this option?

*Use case:*

We use Content by Label to show a list of related topics on a page. The page that contains the macro therefore usually has the same label as the other related pages. This results in the page showing a list of related topics that includes itself.

If we could exclude the current page, this would prevent circular references.
fields.summary: Add option to exclude current page from list shown by Content by Label macro

fields.description:
Creating a plugin with a simple trigger, i.e. one that has a {{repeat-interval}} throws an exception if the user attempts to manually invoke the {{run}}.

I would assume that creating a trigger such as the following would allow a default configuration of once a day since confluence started and allow administrators to override the schedule.

{code:xml}
<trigger key="purgeOldAttachmentsTrigger"
         name="Purge Old Attachments Trigger">
  <job key="purgeOldAttachmentsJob" />
  <!-- Run once a day -->
  <schedule repeat-interval="86400000"/>
  <managed editable="true"
           keepingHistory="true"
           canRunAdhoc="true"
           canDisable="true" />
</trigger>
{code}

The following stack-trace is exhibited when an administrator clicks "Run".

If the design is that an administrator may not invoke the run command then it should be disabled, however I have explicitly set {{canRunAdhoc="true"}}, also note the administrator can not configure the schedule even though {{editable="true"}} has been set.

{noformat}

	at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.managers.DefaultScheduledJobManager.runNow(DefaultScheduledJobManager.java:166)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)

fields.summary: Simple trigger with repeat-interval throws exception on manual run

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25974].
  {panel}

It seems that the images are scaled slightly, which causes especially affects any images containing text.

Steps to reproduce:
* create a page that contains chart plugin (including axis label or similar)
* export this page to pdf
* notice that the text on the chart is reduced in quality

An example where this is even more noticeable when using plugins that render latex. The text in the images is blurred significantly compared to the surrounding text.
fields.summary: When images are exported to pdf, the quality is reduced

fields.description: h3. Summary Creating external URL links containing curly brackets breaks the links. The links become unclickable and the URL address is gone when you try to edit it h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a link URL address [http://test.com/doc=\{123\}|http://test.com/doc=\{123\}] # Save the page h3. Expected Results # The URL link is clickable h3. Actual Results # The URL is not clickable. This is what's shown in the source: {code:html}LINK TEXT{code} h3. Notes # This also happens when adding the link through the Link Macro h3.Workaround Escaping the curly brackets with a backslash would not work. However, replacing the curly brackets with a valid ASCII format would work. This means that open curly bracket *{* is converted to {{%7B}} and closed curly bracket *}* is converted to {{%7D}}. For example [http://test.com/doc=%7B123%7D|http://test.com/doc=%7B123%7D] In case of MS SharePoint another workaround is using [SharePoint ShortUrl|https://store.office.com/en-gb/app.aspx?assetid=WA104368123&ui=en-US&rs=en-GB&ad=GB&appredirect=false]
fields.summary: Creating external URL links containing curly brackets breaks the links

fields.description:
When there is text below a View Office Word macro on a page, that text is styled incorrectly (the text is underlined and sometimes also styled with a different font colour, see attached screen shot). This may not be the most common way to use the macro, but we have instances where we find it useful.

This only applies to .DOCX files, I cannot replicate this issue with .doc files.

I tried to add a user directory (OpenLDAP). Everything works fine with the correct credentials. But with the wrong authentication password (Server Settings --> Password) I get a System Error caused by a NPE.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new LDAP user directory in Confluence Admin
# Fill in the connection details, but put in an invalid password
# Click "Quick Test" or "Save and Test"

h3. Workaround

Use the correct credentials.
fields.summary: NPE when defining LDAP directory and having wrong password
Allow OnDemand importer to import entire sites

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25959].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

* Create numbered list (i.e. 1, 2, 3)
* For each number, create sub-list entries (i.e. 1.a. 1.b. 2.a. 2.b., 3.a., 3.b.)
* Delete the line entry for one of the numbers (i.e. line entry for 2.)
* Problem: the sub-list entries do not re-order (i.e. shows 1.a. 1.b. 1.a. 1.b. instead of 1.a. 1.b. 1.c. 1.d.)
fields.summary: List does not reorder in Confluence upon deletion of line

fields.description:
When my page summary or description contains apostrophe, Confluence Search doesn't return this page as a result for the word which had an apostrophe.
Example : I have a page for which summary is "Changement d'application active".  When I search with the word "application", this page is not in the results...
This makes Confluence almost unusable in french.
fields.summary: Search index includes apostrophe

fields.description:
Customer pointed out the following:
{quote}
Missing translations in German:
* "Go to Intranet"
* Team Calendar: e.g. Mittwoch Today
* Team Calendar: Date format like Donnerstag Jun 28
* Team Calendar: View My Calendars

Bad translations in German:
* "Empfohlen in Intranet" correct it to "Empfohlen im Intranet" or "Interessantes im Intranet"
* "Lesevorgang fortsetzen" would better be "mehr..."
{quote}

See sample screen shots for details. This is seen when using  default Deutsch (Deutschland) language.
fields.summary: Recommended Updates email notification with missing German translation and bad German translation

fields.summary: unable to set adminstrator rights to another user

fields.description:
The Confluence 4.2 rich text editor just reported the following error: bq. Failure when converting editor format to storage format. I have not been able to reproduce this error, but here is (only roughly, sorry) what I did to create it: # Create a new page. # Enter two paragraphs of text, with no other formatting than a link to a user name entered via autocompletion (typing [, then ~, then the user name); on the first attempt, the autocompletion created a link to the profile image, rather than to the user name. (I think the secret must be in here somewhere; the deletion of the first attempt, and the re-creation of the link to the user name. I know that I must have been doing something wrong the first time around for the link to the profile image to have been created, but I am afraid I cannot recall the exact keystrokes.) After receiving the error (and hence, being unable to save the page), I deleted what I thought might be the problem (the link), and then opened the Source Editor plugin to view the XML. The second paragraph, that had contained the link, had the following class attribute: {code}

{code} I deleted the class attribute, returned to the rich text editor, re-created the link to the user name, and saved the page without further ado. In my attempts to reproduce this error, I managed to create XML with the following (to me, extraneous - and, certainly, as far as the view presented by the rich text editor is concerned, invisible) span element around the ac:link: {code}

jhdfkjhdfkdfj dkjdfkjdfkjdf.

{code}
fields.summary: Failure when converting editor format to storage format.

Highlighting of containers of macros that have bodies

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Create a space called Bacon, containing page Blah
2. In space admin, rename space from Bacon to Cheese
3. Type Blah into the quick search field

*Expected behaviour*

Autocomplete suggests page Blah belonging to space Cheese

*Actual behaviour*

Autocomplete suggests page Blah belonging to space Bacon
fields.summary: Renaming a space does not update the space's name in Lucene index entries
Allow only valid mail address as username for invited user

fields.description:
Editing an existing link in Confluence using Internet Explorer 8 causes two different strange behaviors: either the text (next to the link) is converted into a new link OR the link text is automatically changed (the name of the space/page is appended into this text)

*Steps to reproduce (Scenario 1)*
# Edit the page "A note to Confluence administrator" in the Demonstration Space
# Open the link editor for the existing link "Atlassian Confluence Documentation". You do not need to actually edit anything, just press "save".
# Save the page.
# Edit the page again: the link text has magically expanded from "Atlassian Confluence Documentation" to "Atlassian Confluence Documentation online". Looking at it closer, you can see that " online" is actually a second link.
# If the page is saved now, the strange link combination is saved, i.e. also visible in read mode. Cancelling the save action, leaves the original link text intact.

*Steps to reproduce (Scenario 2)*
# Create a new page
# Insert a new link and search for any existing page. Make sure you edit the "Link Text" to something else, for example "Link Test".
# Click insert and save the page
# Edit the page
# Edit the newly created link and click save
# Save the page
# The link text is automatically changed and the name of the page of the link is automatically appended into this text
fields.summary: Editing an existing link produces a strange behavior in IE8
Ability to Assign Entire Groups to Watch Pages/Blogs

fields.description:
Some JavaScripts do not work on Chrome after saving, although it is working upon previewing or refreshing the page. Some simple JS would work, but those that include JS functions won't work. *Steps to reproduce* # Make you sure you enable the HTML macro # Create a new page and insert HTML macro # Add the following code in the macro: {code:html}

This is a paragraph.

{code} # Save the page # Click on "Display Date" button and nothing is displayed NOTE: In the Chrome console (F12), the following error is displayed: "Refused to execute a JavaScript script. Source code of script found within request." This error does not occur when you refresh the page. *Workaround* Refresh the page and the JavaScript will execute!
fields.summary: Some JavaScripts do not work in Chrome after saving
